definition: lit. try to straighten out silk threads only to tangle them further (idiom)/fig. to try to help but end up making things worse
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc
surname Yi
benefit/profit/advantage/beneficial/to increase/to add/all the more
beams in roof/confused
to be cramped in a corner (idiom)
see 方枘圓鑿|方枘圆凿[fang1 rui4 yuan2 zao2]
to sit and waste a good opportunity (idiom); to lose the chance
where will it stop?
the situation (e.g. political)/the state of the world
wishing for profit, but causing loss (idiom); good intentions that lead to disaster/It all ends in tears.
variant of 意識形態|意识形态[yi4 shi2 xing2 tai4]
incompatible
to start on virtue but give up (idiom); to fail to carry things through/lack of sticking power/short attention span
to swim with the tide (idiom)
to foresee/to predict
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
see 越描越黑[yue4 miao2 yue4 hei1]
differing only slightly/not much between them
to trip forwards or stumble back (idiom, from Book of Songs); can't get anything right
making decisions without implementing them
